title: Oil Tops $110 as Russia Struggles to Maintain Energy Sales
sub_head: Brent crude extends gains despite planned release of oil from reserves
body:
Benchmark global oil prices surged above $110 a barrel, hitting a multiyear high, as concern mounted that Russiaâ€™s growing economic isolation since its invasion of Ukraine would disrupt global energy supplies.
The latest run-up came even after members of the International Energy Agency agreed Tuesday to release supplies from their oil reserves, and despite efforts by Western governments to exclude oil and gas from their sanctions on Russia.
